TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit StrongNameKeyPair extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.IDeserializationCallback, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates access to a public or private key pair used to sign strong name assemblies.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to open a Company.keys file (produced by running the [Sn.exe (Strong Name Tool)](../Topic/Sn.exe%20\(Strong%20Name%20Tool\).md) with the **â€“k** switch), read the public key from the file, and display the key in the console window.
[!CODE [StrongNameKeyPairX#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR/StrongNameKeyPairX#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] keyPairArray) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type `byte` containing the key pair.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Reflection.StrongNameKeyPair"> class, building the key pair from a `byte` array.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.FileStream keyPairFile) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Reflection.StrongNameKeyPair"> class, building the key pair from a `FileStream`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string keyPairContainer) cil managed

Docs.param: A string containing the key pair.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Reflection.StrongNameKeyPair"> class, building the key pair from a `String`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The key pair is in a named key container.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"> object that holds the serialized object data.
A <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Reflection.StrongNameKeyPair"> class, building the key pair from serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](../Topic/XML%20and%20SOAP%20Serialization.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the public part of the public key or public key token of the key pair.
Docs.value: An array of type `byte` containing the public key or public key token of the key pair.

Docs.param: The object that initiated the callback.
